title: Fractal Complexity and Economic Development: Sustainable Growth Strategies in the Era of Collaborative Democracy

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary economics, systems thinking, and foundational ecological concepts
context.additional_context: Hybrid learning combining online collaboration tools with offline workshops in BYOD environments

learning_goals: They can explain a framework for analyzing economic systems from the perspective of fractal complexity.
They can apply the concepts of hierarchical coherence and fractal connectivity to real-world cases.
They can propose strategies for designing region-based entrepreneurial ecosystems in a collaborative democratic environment.
They can evaluate methodologies for measuring systemic interconnectedness as an alternative indicator to GDP.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
